"Straight hood!"The protagonists chanting the movie's title in the climaxAlso, I'd just like to say, did the writers of this movie know that they were writing the worst film of all time?  I feel sorry for them...and hateful, for putting me through this crap fest.1/10.

This is is terrible!!From the beginning to the end is just horrible. The bad acting,and predictable storyline is just repetitive. Yet again Jennifer Freeman manages to show she has no acting ability whatsoever.In fact no could really act Omarion and B2k performance was horrible to watch,when the little boy died i was laughing not because he died,it was because of their reactions were to it. The dancing was very good if only they never opened their mouths. The bad acting was hard to get over i found myself laughing thinking how could someone film this train wreak and expect success?? Very very boring and predictable. Not recommendable
This movie for me is on the same level as the room it's so bad it's a masterpiece after some point I was just dying laughing in my house alone 10/10 would recommend

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies of all time
reviews.content: Tons of dancing, over acting, use of the word crew, and lots of bad hair. Some where in there they forgot to add a plot or anything that makes the movie worth watching. Every event is predictable and there is nothing in this film worth taking note of. One of the major turn offs was the fact that all, and I stress the word all, actors in this movie tried overly hard to be "cool" which made for awkward scenes and ignorant script lines. It was almost impossible to sit through this entire film and I was glad to see when it was over... which the end of the movie, where the credits roll, was the best part. I would rate this a negative 1 but it wont allow it.

This movie did not deserve to be the last one on the worst. It really was not that bad.  I have seen worse, much worse. I loved the dance moves. People who want to see tap dancing live in a different generation then the one that this movie was intended for.  You may also live in another culture. To all of you who voted 1 I say give the movie another try. I am not saying that is was the best movie in the world, but i know it was far from the worst(even Gigli got better ratings). I say leave the young kids along and lets pick on Gigli some more.:)

reviews.review_title: If you have a chainsaw and some time...
reviews.content: Given how bad this movie is, if you have an hour and a half or so to kill and a chainsaw, go ahead and cut off some of your limbs. It will be less excruciating. This movie seems like a dress rehearsal that was unedited and shown after one take. Go ahead and watch some break dancing movies to get the only entertainment value in the movie. And if you hate montage sequences, then you'll probably want to put a bullet in your brain and the brain of everyone involved in creating the film, though it seems inconclusive that any of those involved have any mental facilities whatsoever. I wish it was possible to give out zeroes, because I think that giving this movie any credit is ridiculous. Honestly, if you are reduced to watching this movie, as I was, you live a sad and pathetic life.

The reviews here are far more entertaining than the movie itself; but I watched the flick to see what the fuss was about and WHOA it IS that bad! All I can add is how can anyone here like the movie for its dancing??? That opening scene where the guy pretends to be a sculpture has got to be the dumbest thing I have ever seen on film. Ever. And the dancing is so damn repetitive and boring after a while. This thing blew me away for the wrong reasons... It has atrocious camera-work and editing... I wonder if they required any of the cast to take ANY kind of acting classes before filming... chock full of mind-numbing stereotypes... I can go on but it almost goes without saying I think.Anyway one of the worst movies to be theater-released in a long time IMO

I mean seriously, I don't even have a review for this movie it was so bad I do have a story.I saw the trailer for this movie in the theater about a year before this story even took place and when I saw it, I wanted to turn off my life right there it was so bad I didn't make it through the trailer, I just had to leave, any movie that incorporates dancing and idiots in the same movie shouldn't have been made but on with the real story. I come home from work one afternoon, no one is home and I'm really bored I notice there are a couple of rented videos on the top of the TV. I proceed to look at what they are, one happened to be you got served. Sounded good to me. I put it in, within 8 minutes of viewing this movie, I got up and pulled my DVD straight off the shelf walked outside and smashed it over the first person I saw. I have no qualms about saying that this movie ruined my DVD player, no other movie should ever go in there after this travesty. I guess, and it is proved by this movie, that anyone can get money to make a movie about virtually anything. If you value your DVD player, or even your VHS don't watch this or you'll probably have to resort to the measures I did to get this movie out of your life. Forever.I voted 1 out of 10, put clearly a rating qualified for this movie isn't available on IMDb, the rating is Celebacy, meaning that the actors, writers, crew and directors of this movie should never be able to breed.

reviews.review_title: the 15th worst movie of all times?
reviews.content: I saw it short after it release and I went with 10 of my friends cause we were stunned by the trailer and all of this crazy dancing scenes. Well, actually there was no mention of the "surrounding plot", which later turned out to be brainless teenage garbage mixed with some b/w feud. It is critical in such a movie where the groups are mostly divided by skin color that Lil'kim later predictably emphasizes that she wants the blacks to win the tournament. OK I have to point out I'm white, so although I disliked the white braggers cause they were presented in an unsportsmanlike manner. Well well in fact I did unfortunately forget to mention the real "story" played by so-called "actors" which such a refreshing "skill" and such a delightful "humor" and such a "happy end". The story is nonsense completely so I don't even rate it. The choreographies of the dancing scenes are wonderfully directed and performed so I guess 4 points as overall score might fit.And head back to the original topic of my comment, I don't assume this is one of the worst movies "bottom 15th" that's a bit too blatant.

reviews.review_title: Love this movie since it came out in early 2000s
reviews.content: I loved this movie. One of my favs!! Some of it took me back to my child hood growing up in he city. Never def soo much of this I could relate. Just a fun but real movie!!! And the dancing was SICK! I thought acting was pretty good. But it was fun movie. But also some real drama stuff. I loved it.

This is the original and the BEST dance battle movie! Of course the story and acting are not great, but that's not what a movie like this is about; those aspects are incidental to a movie BURSTING with charm, electrifying battle scenes and a killer soundtrack. The whole cast were in their prime (and incredibly hot which never hurts) and the passion and love for their craft pours off the screen. People are taking this movie WAY too seriously and are totally missing what it's all about. It's not meant to be a gritty commentary on ghetto life in LA. What it's meant to be is a fantastic celebration of the skill and passion and phenomenal force of nature that was organic street dance battling. This remains one of the most hugely influential aspects of African American culture. It changed the music industry forever, launched countless entertainment careers and spawned countless imitation "dance movies". I'm not ashamed to say I LOVE THIS MOVIE and it will always be one of my all time favourites ever!!!

reviews.review_title: funny but a waste of time
reviews.content: the only redeeming part of this movie was the dance moves and beautiful. the acting was horrible. the lines were stupid. throughout the movie i was thinking, what kind of idiot did they get to write the dialogue? don't watch it if you're looking for a movie with substance. Yeah and they made the wrong people say the wrong lines. Like they made the white guys say all thuggishly, "You just got served." It definitely sounded all wrong. I mean c;mon, have a black guy say it, not a 20 year old blonde, metrosexual, white man. Oh and so you just wont waste time watching it, the only good part was when that girl asked Omarion if he liked her... that was the funniest part, sad huh?

This is not a movie that one is going to give awards or kudos to for its acting or its storyline.  But the music and the dancing is another story.  I like what I felt was a blend of old school and new school hip-hop and pop music to make a very interesting and enjoyable soundtrack.  The dancing in my opinion was very entertaining and off the hook.  Do not go to the theater to watch this movie.  Its not worth the $10.  But if you're a hip-hop and/or street/break dancing fan this movie is definitely one worth renting.  Its not a movie that I am likely to make it a point to go out and see again, but once it hits cable I wouldn't be surprised to find many channel surfers stopping in to check out the arsenal of dances moves this movie unloads.  Feel free to enjoy this movie for what it is - one big hip-hop house song and dance show.

I'll keep this review brief. This was easily the worst movie of 2004. Critics of critics might say that if you don't like this movie you cant dance and to that I respond: ain't no call like a booty call cause' a booty call don't call yo booty. That doesn't make sense right? Of course not and neither does your rebuttal to those that hate this movie so shut up! And now......the review.The whole thing is about two kids whose dance crew is challenged by some preppy wanna-be-black suburbanites who steal the crew's moves thanks to a treacherous friend named Sonny. Omarion and Marques's character fall out over Omarion dating Marques's sister and things get more problematic from then on. The acting is atrocious and the dance moves might be cool at first but get pretty mundane after a while. Omarion as well as Marques Houston cant act. Lil Kim looks like recovering heroine junkie and the attractive Jennifer Freeman(My Wife and Kids) is whiter than Jenny McCarthy. You can tell this was a vanity project for the suspiciously effeminate Chris Stokes. And it still bombed! If you're into a movie all about dancing then go right ahead but if you're looking for something more than a dull dance film with heavily edited dance scenes look elsewhere. You just got served suckaz!

reviews.review_title: It's not as bad as everyone says it is...
reviews.content: I know. I've seen You Got Served. I saw it in the theaters with my entire dance studio. Don't think I didn't peel over laughing as some of the most horribly executed lines in cinema were delivered. Don't think I didn't almost pass out from laughter during the "I'm-so-upset-I-must-dance-out-all-my-pain-in-the-rain" montage. And don't think I didn't find it just a little bit hilarious when Wade Robson popped in at the end to deliver a laundry list of all the famous people he's worked for. I did. I did all those things.But I also realized that the main point of this movie wasn't to deliver Oscar-caliber acting performances that would move people to tears and have them fondly remembering Marques Houston's portrayal of Elgin for many years to come. I think what many people fail to remember upon seeing this movie is this: You Got Served is a DANCE MOVIE. So let's break that down: It is a MOVIE about DANCE. Simple enough. Look at the movie There's Something About Mary. That is a comedic movie. Given that categorization, one could safely assume that the point of the movie is to be comedic, which it was. The acting was also decent, so all around, it's a good flick.Now let's go back to You Got Served. Since it was a dance movie, it would also be safe to assume that the point of this movie was to portray dance. Did You Got Served do that? Oh yes, it did. The dance in that movie is phenomenal. The choreography is completely on point and innovative. Many of the extras in that movie are real life Los Angeles dancers and b-boys and b-girls. Take a look at the extras on the DVD. It shows how the opening sequence of the movie was shot- it was all in one take. They take you from camera to camera to camera while everyone just dances. It's phenomenal. And it's a true cinematic achievement in dance.Now am I saying that this excuses the shoddy acting jobs done by the actors in this movie? Of course not. The lines were laughable. The dialog was predictable. And you could see the ending an hour before it came. But I'm also saying that if you went into the movie You Got Served expecting a gritty expose on the underground dance scene with riveting performances, you came at the movie completely the wrong way. The way to watch this movie is as a dancer or just as someone who appreciates good dance. If you watch You Got Served with that in mind, I guarantee it will become a more enjoyable film than if you just rag on the acting.

So I didn't think there could be a movie bad enough to knock out Battlefield Earth from the top of my personal all time worst movies list. Now before I go any further I have to say that the moves were SICK. At the end of the movie the 'Matrix' move had me out of my seat.Now if they didn't say or do anything else through the whole 90 minutes of movie it just may have been 'almost OK'. But the so-called 'acting' was about on par with the so-called 'plot' - undeniably the worst I've ever seen. There is no explanation for about half the plot points, some of the worst dialog I have ever heard, no type of character development and no believable chemistry in the romance. It's like The two new 'Star Wars' movies. I could believe that George Lucas wrote and directed it, except there aren't enough digital characters.Meagan, Meagan, Meagan.... I reeeeeally hope that D.E.B.S. is good because along with 'Biker Boyz' and 'Ride or Die' you have been in my three worst movies this year....There are 2 reasons why I wasted time and money watching this movie:As a kid I loved 'Breakin' and I thought that this movie would have that kind of fun and energy. Also South Park dedicated a whole episode to ripping this film and I didn't believe that it could possibly be that bad.... Trey and Matt I was soooo wrong.Don't waste your time or money with this movie. Go find yourself a Missy Elliott video or three and you'll get the same dancing satisfaction without the nasty aftertaste.

This movie has awesome, creative, high energy dancing.  The flexibility and inventiveness of the dance moves will take your breath away.  I love how women were part of the battle crews and not video hos or hoochie mamas. It's been too long since we've seen Jackée Harry, so she was a nice surprise.  Lil Kim held her own too.To appreciate how far the Hip Hop dancing culture has evolved, check out the moves Special K, Ozone and Turbo do in Breakin' from 1984.  This movie has a lot of the same moves, taken to the next level.If you want more out of this movie than to see some impressive dancing, then you should check out another movie.  I plan to buy this DVD and You Got Served: Take it to the Streets for the dance scenes.

reviews.review_title: If you don't like break dancing please step AWAY from the movie :)
reviews.content: First let's get a few things straight: the acting is horrible, the dialogs are absolutely awful, but the dance scenes, choreography and moves are fantastic. If you like break dancing and have a fast forward button on the remote you'll just LOVE this movie, but if you don't like break dancing don't even bother renting it. I'd give it a 9 out of 10 for the dancing parts, and a 3 out of 10 for the rest of the movie (believe it or not, the acting is not the absolute worst I've ever seen) so a happy average of 6 (in my "break dancing fan" opinion) is suitable.Conclusion: watch only if you like break dancing.

or you'll be served! This movie is like the new millennium version of "Flashdance," "Saturday Night Fever," "Grease," "Oklahoma!," "The Sound of Music," and just about any other classical musical or music movie! Why am I saying this, even though those titles have no connection to "You Got Served" whatsoever? Because they all have music! No boring, sleepy musical numbers here! Just all the hip-hop and floor dancing that you can handle! Many kids, teenagers, and young adults love the rage that is hip-hop and dancing these days. "You Got Served" is a movie that is the best of both of those worlds. Enjoy it, and then, get funky!

reviews.review_title: look past the horrible acting/writing & watch the dancing
reviews.content: Look. Not all movies are going to try to change the world. If you just take this movie for what it is - a showcase of amazing dancing - you can ignore the very cheesy acting, not to mention the horrible script. I originally saw this movie in the theatre & people were standing up & cheering during the opening dance-off which takes place in the first 2 minutes of the movie. There are so many points during this movie where you will be yelling at the TV & reaching for the remote because you won't be able to believe what you just saw. Not everybody will enjoy this film; I'll be the first one to admit that the story is super predictable & the acting is bad, but, if you're like me & you love dancing, especially break dancing, you won't even notice the other shortcomings of this film.

This is not a movie to be honest. It's more like a dance video in the sense that the dance moves were very good, they're professionals so what would you expect. The plot, however, was less than impressive, it was ridiculous. But if I were to give an open minded view, then I guess the plot wasn't really 1 out of 10, but the acting made it all so, so bad.It's a pity really, with the beautiful Jennifer Freeman and respectable Steve Harvey starring in a quite dismal set up all together. Omarion is an excellent artist, but I think he should stick to his music and dance.In all honesty, a young child and think 'wow, they got skill', but even that young child would struggle to complement anything else.To sum it up, I will say the good points about this movie are the dance moves. The bad points are everything else! Waste of time, don't watch it, just check the trailer for the dance, and go on youtube!

reviews.review_title: Further proof that humanity is beyond redemption (spoilers)
reviews.content: Hip-hop has given us many things: bad music, appalling fashion, ridiculous names. But all of these crimes against humanity pale into insignificance when compared to You Got Served, a film so uniformly atrocious that it made me wish for nuclear war; we're a vile species and deserve to be exterminated with extreme prejudice  "You got served, planet Earth! Pwned!" For what it's worth (and it's worth less than nothing), You Got Served is about a couple of friends who want to win a dance competition. They want to open a recording studio or something with the money. But of course they have to dance to fulfil their dreams.Sweet Jeebus, is the dancing bad (and by bad I don't mean good). Kind of imagine the video to "It's Like That", only it's taken seriously and it goes on for ninety minutes  I've calculated that watching people in tracksuits spinning on their heads, grabbing their privates and spazzing like they've got Parkinson's is entertaining for approximately three seconds.I guess we're meant to be glad that these kids are settling their differences on the dance floor instead of, er, in da hood, but personally I'd have more respect for these kids if they were car-jackers and crack smokers. After all, gangsters are scum, but dancers are far worse. But I still can't get over the 'dance-offs'. Settling your differences by doing the robot may appear flamboyant, but instead it's merely retarded. (The old guy who runs these dance-offs actually makes this quote: "Don't come up in here with all that disrespect We settle it on the floor like men." With parent figures like that, no wonder these kids are adrift in an ocean of idiocy.) But mentioning gangsters reminds me that the film does indeed touch upon criminality. You see, our two heroes have to do some courier work so that they can raise money to make expensive bets (five grand in one case) on their dance competitions. Oh, the humanity! Damn The Man! You see what society does to dancers who just want to make a quick, off-hand five thousand dollar bet; it forces them into crime! But to be fair, one of the characters does scrounge a grand off of his grandmother. Wha-wha-what?!? Yeah, that's right, this mental-midget tells his grandmother that he needs a grand for a dance competitionand she gives it to him! What planet are they living on? (And more importantly, can granny give me a grand too? I want use it as a stake in a circle-jerk.) But what makes me laugh the most about the film is the middle class obsession  the kids have very nice homes  with 'street'. Yeah, dance-offs are how they settle things downtown. Yeah, down there they settle their differences with effeminate dance routines. Honestly, do any of these characters believe a word they say? I mean, Lil' Kim pops up to judge the final dance-off, the one that will give the winners fifty grand and a chance to star in her latest video, and she practically orgasms when one of the crews (crews!) suggests that they take the final dance-off to the streets. "Streets? Now you're talking. Alright everybody, we've decided to take it to the streets!" Except they're in a studio and they're on MTV. And then a couple of seconds later there's this exchange: "Y'all tear this mother up. I want you to get grimy and dirty. Straight street." "How street d'you want us to get?" "You know how I like it, baby. Straight hood." Chinese babies with special needs speak more sense. But to cap it off, Lil' Kim then says, "May the dopest crew win." May the dopest crew win? I think those are going to be my final words. Those are going to be the words I speak on my deathbed. I'm going to be lying there, dying of cancer of the rectum, and I'm going to turn to my family, and with disgust in my eyes and incredulity in my voice, utter, "May the dopest crew win?"But there are other linguistic horrors. "Hey, y'all were off the chain tonight", "Y'all suckers just make sure you're there by sundown" (Sundown?!? I feel like Larry David. "By sundown? Is the posse going to come and get me?"), "You suckas got served" and, best of all in my eyes, "Go home and stop acting like a ho!" And that's someone talking to their sister! Oh, and the same bloke says "Don't disrespect me" while grabbing his sister by the hair. Remember, this is one of the good guys! Oh, someone nuke this planet quick...

reviews.review_title: This is the Dance Movie of the Year !!!
reviews.content: When I went to watch this movie, I expected nothing more except watching nifty dance moves and cool dance sequence which is wonderfully choreographed. And I got what I want. So if ya'll wanna watch a movie with good script, storyline and acting, forget it. Don't watch this movie then. It's all about dance !!! yee hah !!! Something like 'Bring It On', which is the better movie among these two... So my verdict...For the dance sequence : 9 out of 10 For the movie : 5 out of 10P/s: Hey, this movie don't deserve to get #1 for worst movie...c'mon guys !

Let me tell you a little story. It comes in two parts. Once you've read them both, put them in the correct order.1) One evening, they decided to put together the concept for their movie. They would have actors from two pop music groups to pose as gangsters, both with a dream of making it big in the dance/hip hop scene. They would cast the actors into two rival groups that would eventually double cross each other and fight until they reach a grand climax in the final contest between the two, where eventually, all is happy and the two bury the hatchet and ride off into the sunset. They believed that this would make a spectacular Summer movie and would gain approval from the public and it's target audience and be a sure-fire hit at the box office.2) A group of money hungry, corporate tossers, led by a clueless imbecile named Chris Stokes, decided to go completely out of their depth and try to make a summer blockbuster, after hitting about 20 shots of LSD.OK, Was your answer 2-1? Correct. You see, You Got Served is the sort of film that will be waiting for you down in the pits of hell. Satan will even give you a comfy chair and widescreen TV, as sitting on a bed of hot coals would be too much of a pleasant distraction.The only defence I'll have of this vile, pop marketed, hateful garbage is that it didn't deserve to top Manos the Hands Of Fate at number one when it did. Even after 40 years, Manos has no parallel in terms of badness. But it's still an awful movie that deserves the panning it received.Don't watch this film.

reviews.review_title: YGS vs. Flashdance, Breakin & Dirty Dancing
reviews.content: Many people have compared this movie to Breakin'; which, back in it's day, was the "freshest" new thing to come around.  It helped to start a trend around the U.S.  But as far as plot line goes...  I saw it the other day; and although the dancing was good, the plot was totally predictable.  The same goes for Flashdance.  Although people still have a connection with that movie.  They are constantly doing the "where are they now" segments for that movie.  And even though we know a dance double, and a man did almost all of Jennifer Beals' dancing moves, the movie remains popular to this day.  The same thing goes for Dirty Dancing.  The critics HATED that movie.  They thought the plot was formula and the only good parts were the dancing segments.  But people still love that movie.  In fact, I bought it a month ago, because at the time it came out,I was a sophomore in high school. For some reason we connected with that movie.  The plot IS formula, but we love it anyway.  "Nobody puts Baby in a corner"  COME ON!!  But the dancing in that movie was something no one had seen before, and inspired a dance troop who toured throughout the U.S., just to dance to the music.  I see You Got Served in the same light.  Yes, the plot was formula, but the dancing was incredible.  My husband and I were falling out of our seats in awe.  We went to see it at 10:00 on a Monday night, and we were the only one's there... which was a good thing.  We were vocally commenting on the dance moves...."WHOA", "OH MY GOD", and "DID YOU SEE THAT???"  We couldn't help ourselves.  So, on this basis, I rated the film an 8.  It is no LOTR or Mystic River, but I would like to see Orlando or Kevin Bacon do some of those moves. Which brings to mind.... I should add Footloose to that list of "Formula dance movies which we love". :-)  Alisa

I would like to say that this movie was inspiring for me in changing my life for the better. Before this film, I was a 35 year old married man with two kids and a golden retriever named Phillip. Then, I saw this movie. Let me start off by saying that besides being entertaining (I have seen this film over twenty times), I decided that my life was mundane and boring and a change was necessary.So, I moved out of the house and decided to follow my dream to become a dancer. My mother and all her friends had always said I was the best Macarena dancer at my Bar Mitzvah, and this just seemed appropriate. I am currently in the local theater production of "Jesus Christ Superstar", but a little bird is in my ear whispering "Broadway" as we speak. I feel great about my life for once, and we can all thank this movie.

reviews.review_title: and the point of this was...
reviews.content: that is the problem, there was no point. It was so boring. It's about some street kids who lost a dance off for 5000 dollars when one of their buds tells the other crew their dance moves. One of them gets in trouble with a drug dealer and owes money. Another dance contest comes along in which they can win 50000 dollars and a spot in Little Kim's video. Jees, I wonder who wins. And Lit Kim was so bad in this. Who wrote her lines, a 8 year old.And I didn't think there was anything special about their dance moves. And the music was awful.FINAL VERDICT: One of the worst, pointless movies ever. I don't recommend it for anyone.

I recently was invited to see a screening of this movie for free, and I have to say it was exactly what I expected.  If you've seen Drumline or any other of this type than you've seen you've got served.  Hollywood just keeps making these same plot movies with a different setting.  The acting is some of the worst in history, and the story line is slow.  The best part of this movie is the feeling you get when it's over and you get to leave.

I saw this movie on february 7 on my birthday and all i have to say, is it was the best movie i've seen in a long time. i also heard, that there will be a sequel to it, i cant wait!!!! MARQUES AND OMARI WORK VERY WELL TOGETHER... with the moves they have, HMMMMM makes you wonder LOL but, they did a great job, and i can't wait to see them in the sequel... i loved the moves that was exciting and i bet they had a lot of fun doing them. the director did a great job as well. i wish the dance instructor can show me how to move like that lol.... those were some awesome moves my back ached thinking about it but, I'm sure it was worth it.. great job guys hurry up with the sequel PLEASE!!

It doesn't get any better than this! I watched Honey, Save the Last Dance, and Step Up. This movie out did them all with the pure energy from the dance scenes. The movie made me want to go out and learn all the last hip hop dances. I watch this movie over and over, granted, mainly for the dance scenes and the music, but that's the whole point of the movie! Everyone has something to say about the overall story. People complain about lame action movies in the same way. Most of Jackie Chan, Jean Claude Van Damme, Steven Seagal movies don't have a great storyline. But the story sets enough of a backdrop so what you came for; the action, will unfold. Its the same way with You Got Served. If you want to watch a movie where the dancing and the storyline were put together better, watch Stomp the Yard. The same dance choreographer, Dave Scott, worked on both films. Well, there is my two cents. I hope you decided to pick this up at Walmart or rent it at Blockbuster. I'm tired of people hating on this film simple because thestory lacked beef. The movie accomplished what it set out to do: update the urban dance genre. If you look at this movie as a movie you won't be impressed. If you look at it as a hip-hop dance movie. This is the best movie out there yet.

reviews.review_title: The dancing was better than the acting.
reviews.content: The actors really can't act very well. I thought the dancing was way better than the acting. It wasn't my favorite movie. Maybe if the actors got some acting lessons, and changed the movie story line. If the movie was free to get into I still wouldn't see it again.

You got served is a real life look at the streets and world many of the younger generation live in. personally me and my crew battle on most weekends, mainly with great success. The writers and directors judged the mood and the speed of the film with a touch of class. i was very impressed with Mr Rad acting as a 'father' figure for the youngsters as these battles can often go wrong and lead to problems outside the ring. its an important point to show winning isn't the be all and end all of the battle. For me and my crew it's about team bonding and a sense of self worth that is fleeting in these modern times. i don't what people others feel about the film, it's a classic for me and the crew. we even copied a few moves

This film was bad. But if I have to read one more diatribe from some unemployed liberal arts student, throwing out these important phrases like 'cinematic elements' and 'cliche montages,' I might just puke in my suit. What were you expecting?!? A movie starring a bunch of teenagers, one in particular a hip-hop artist, focusing on urban hoedowns? I was entertained, and is just what i was hoping for. Plenty of acrobatics, great rhythms, a bunch of beautiful people throwing out some stereotypic urban slang, which was laughable at times, and a predictable happy ending.What's the problem? I hope a few more people give it some 10's to raise it off of the 100 worst movies list.

It is very conselating to see that this pile of crap got what it deserved and received the title "Worst movie of all time".Here are a few of its major flaws.-The acting was done by rappers (that already suck) and it was plainly not good.-The dialogue probably wasn't even understandable to the writers.-Extreme amount of plot holes and gaps.-Less than impressive dancing. (in my opinion, I've seen better on amateur videos from the 80s)-Characters that lived in very decent looking lives resorting to drug dealing for money.-And even the camera work was less than admirable.This movie sucked!...... God!!!

I haven't even seen this movie, and I can already tell that it has got to be the worst movie ever made. However, my friends and I have had such a great time making fun of the preview, that maybe it is worth something...a good laugh.

so, it's finally out on video rental stores. i've been waiting for this one for quite some times now and finally got to see it. good, must you say?in my opinion, it's great. the dance moves are sweet and finely choreographed. as for the story, if you're into the after school TV special sort of thing that comes on abc TV or nickelodeon or Disney channel sort of thing, you'll like this one. one thing this movie boils on down to is the dance scenes, dance scenes, dance scenes. urban break dancing has been around for quite some times and in this film, they highlighted it nicely right on the nail. sort of reminds me of watching "breakin'" back when i was a kid. for anyone who's into watching urban break dancing this has got to be the one to see. these actors and actresses may not win big-time awards for acting but they get the job done. my score 8/10 for entertainment value if you're into this sort of thing. if you're not, do check it out anyway. it'll be fun.

After seeing this movie, I had realized that I'd lost something that I would never get back. Over an hour of my life was gone.
This movie is a decent attempt at a breakdancing movie (which doesn't say much) but falls short of other films in this genre. It features no plot and less than mediocore dance sequences. The problem with the dance sequences is the fact that they all lack originality. I was hoping to see dance sequences like the classic Michael 'Boogaloo Shrimp' Chambers broom sequence.Breakdancing films in the past have been enjoyable and full of laughs and great dance sequences from start to finish. The director of this movie, clearly did not recognize the golden breakdancing movie that started it all: Breakin'. With an all star cast (Lucinda Dickey, Adolfo 'Shabba-Doo' Quinones, Michael 'Boogaloo Shrimp' Chambers, Phineas Newborn III, Ice-T and even a guest appearance by Jeanne Claude Van Damme) and a riveting plot, Breakin' is a good recommendation for any fan of the breakdancing genre. See it instead of You Got Served if its not too late. Breakin' also featured rebellious dancers who wore Pink Floyd hats.Breakin' 2, even without Jeanne Claude Van Damme as an extra, is also a fantastic choice as its story (A developer tries to bulldoze a community recreation center. The local breakdancers try to stop it) is even better than that of its prequel. You'll Laugh, and cry as it (to me) was the most touching movie I have ever seen.You Got Served, does lack most of what Breakin' has, but the most disturbing part of it was the lack of Danny Trejo. Danny Trejo has appeared in movies such as Con Air and Desert heat, and would be ideal to play the parts of Vick or Rashaan.In conclusion, with an only partially charged Boogaloo, this movie is only watchable to a diehard fan of the genre.

I'll just list some things that bothered me during this movie:-the line "you guys were off the chain tonight"...honestly what does that mean-the lack of fathers throughout the movie, to be fair to black people (not all black children are fathered illegitimately)-Steve Harvey's roll as Mr. Rad was far too underplayed-the best dance scene was done by a rival group, and they ended up losing-this was the most stereotypical movie of black people I've ever seen, it ran through a constant sequence of: dancing, basketball, girls, fried chicken, selling illegal contraband, and the ever apparent lack of money)

I haven't even seen this movie.  Yet simple based on the title alone, which for me is battling Ballistic: Ecks vs.Sever as worst movie title EVER, I have to get it an honorary 1.  Wish I could give it a negative 4.Yes I have seen the previews and this looks like a male version of that stupid-ass cheerleader movie Bring it On.  Why don't they simply call it "No You Dzind't" (say it phonetically and wag your head and finger) and get it over with.  Has street culture so permeated all culture that even a freaking "dance off" can be made to be badass?Please.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst films out there
reviews.content: This film was pointless. The plot was worthless and the characters were one dimensional. The movie was trying to be dramatic, but the acting was so bad that it made the film one of the worst ever. Instead of concentrating on the dance moves they should have concentrated on the story line, acting, and forming better characters. I don't see how anyone would like this film for any important reasons. They might like it for the music, dance movies, guys in it, and maybe just because every one in their teens have seen it. That is really the only group of people that would watch the film in the first place. I can't even see how they got that big of an audience to see the film, This film is one of the worst and isn't respected or watched for the right reasons.

Yo Omarion Grandberry and Marques "Batman" Houston are the bomb. That is only one reason why I watch You Got Served. I love the brake dancing.Omarion and Marques, I know ya'll are brothers and it is hard to not speak to each other when ya'll love each other so much. Y'all are such awesome actors and singers and dancers. Omarion I love the part when you are dancing and you do a back flip and you pushed off that guys chest. I love y'all so much, I have a poster of y'all in my locker and I watch the movie EVERY night. I at the LEAST watch the movie two or three times a day. I have practically memorized the whole movie.I LOVE y'all. Now, you know why I voted the movie a 10 out of 10 for excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

`You Got Served' harkens back to those films from the 80s like `Breakin' and `Beat Street,' low budget jobs aimed at devotees of competitive street dancing, a niche market if ever there was one.  `You Got Served' demonstrates that while the dance moves may have advanced in style and sophistication in the past twenty years, the plotting certainly hasn't kept up with the pace.   In this film, a popular LA dance crew from the hood is challenged to a $5,000 showdown by a rival crew from, of all places, Orange County.  Add to this a dash of gang violence, a dollop of puppy-love romance and an MTV-sponsored competition finale and you have the makings of a pretty standard youth-must-be-served flick.  A movie like `You Got Served' clearly exists for its dance sequences and little else.  The choreography is fine, I guess, but without an interesting story to effectively tie the routines together, even the dancing becomes tedious after awhile.  If you can look beyond the dull story and amateurish acting, you may enjoy `You Got Served.'  Otherwise, it's a loser's bet all the way.

reviews.review_title: I was ill and maybe a little delirious when I watched this movie
reviews.content: Like I said on the summary I was a little delirious with a fever and so when I watched this movie I seemed to be enjoying it....I am a person who dislikes singers/rappers who turn to the movie industry and vow to become a movie star...Except Will Smith...He's beyond the mere heights of mortals...I found the acting very bad....the script was bad....the plot was bad... and the actors....laughable....But I enjoyed the dancing...Again I must stress I was delirious...Meagen Good was beautiful as always and kept the movie going however I would have liked to seen her get the lead role...

I don't no what u guys are thinking but this is a good movie, it would have taken a lot of time,effort and money to find that sort of talent, then make up countless dances then produce the whole thing into a good movie, which is exactly what they have done, the acting is not the best but I'd rather watch this then some Meg Ryan garbage. Quite afew times during the movie I was surprised at some of the moves they pulled out, plus the story line was good.Its good to see African Americans doing so well, I hope it encourages others to step out to show off they're talent I recommend this movie as it is fun and entertaining for a boring Sunday afternoon. And I am guessing that all of the people who rated it bad paid money to see the film so all I can say is...you suckers got served

Um, okay, this movie is not great. I'll admit.But what are all you people doing coming on here and ranting about it? OF COURSE the plot is going to be vacuous, the acting terrible, and the outcome totally predictable. It is a movie about Break dancing! These people did not set out to make another Citizen Kane, they were making a movie about break dancing.The plot and acting was as bad as I expected, but the dancing was pretty awesome. If any complaint about this movie is valid, there should have been more dancing. And that white boy who has the crazy pop-locking robot style should have gone a little more off the hook than just hopping around on his knees.Bottom line: if you paid to see this in theaters, and were expecting to see a movie masterpiece, YOU GOT what you deSERVED!

reviews.review_title: ELECTRIFYING DANCING MESHES THE FILM TOGETHER!
reviews.content: I can't say that this film is good. And I can't say this film is bad. It's alright and because some of the mose electrifying and entertaining dance scenes ever it's pretty good.  The only time the film runs into problems is when they stop dancing which is quite a bit. The film sports very few few believable performances and some down out horrid ones. The dialogue is uninspired and uninteresting. And the thin plot is layered with cliched but conceivable melodrama. The film is about a group of poor boys in a dance gang whom decide to battle an opposing rich gang from another neighborhood for a sum of 50,000 dollars and the chance to appear in a Lil Kim video. And thats essetially it besides some pitfalls along the way including betrayal, family, death, etc. The usual ingredients in an urban set film. It's so weird how this type of film fits a certain genre and they just try to roll with it. Instead of inducing realism or creativity it in the end becomes contrived and just plain played out. But the film is by no means horrible. It is entertaining and almost suceeds at what it sets out to accomplish. Theres no real suprises here but overall it remains above average refusing to settle into the unwatchable dreck that they've released in the past. Just next time around some creativity and believability would be greatly appreciated.

This has to be most stupid and non sense movie ever made ?? Or what ? Is this a joke? :D first i thought this was like a satiric movie but when i realized that they are trying it be somehow serious i nearly died off
burn all copies of the movie and burry it on the moon.

reviews.review_title: The best of the worst movies ever.
reviews.content: This was one of those movies that I saw in hopes of being able to laugh at it. I ended up on the floor. The plot moves so fast that I thought it might be over in 30 minutes but it is all about the dance scenes. After being "served" by a female dancer a guy in a Blazers jersey steps up, runs his fingers up this girl, and turns to his boys. He then knocks them over like dominos with the apparent stink on his fingers. Needless to say she wasn't happy with being served. Meanwhile, all the scenes involving the vague reference to drug sales are so dumbed down as if for family viewing. I hear that there is a push to label this movie the worst ever? It is so bad it is great. It could take a couple of those top 250 out.

reviews.review_title: A long music video, not bad for dance/music lovers ...not good for movie lovers
reviews.content: This film focuses on the typical hardships of ghetto youths (perhaps too typical) trying to survive in their rough conditions. You have the usual street basketball games, drug dealing and the typical monstrously scary crime boss.The story attempts to invite certain conflicts in the script, however the majority of conflicts are very predictable and amateur in nature. Yet, I find the dance moves in the movie were very well choreographed. This fact saves the movie from a complete failure in my eyes. I found myself rewinding and replaying parts of this movie a couple times. My rating: 5/10.

I reluctantly went to see this movie. If it were not for the dance sequences this would truly be one horrible movie. The acting in this movie is bad. The direction of the film also lacked a sense of continuity. Overall this is a bad movie to go watch. If you are with of group of friends and you want to just sit and talk through the movie, then this is your movie. This movie doesn't have any characters who truly develop into anyone we care about. There are too many loose ends in the movie. And honestly who really have dance battles? Save your money and wait for the DVD and rent it cheaper.

reviews.review_title: I guess We Got Served for thinking that this would be a good movie
reviews.content: I'm sorry this movie was terrible. Only thing good about this movie was the dancing but that's the only thing that saves this movie and even that still wasn't enough for me. The cinematography was super weak like it looked like a Disney channel original movie. The acting was atrocious only Marques Houston really did anything for the acting part. Again still trying to figure out who got served. Turns out the people who made this movie served themselves cause man what a horrible film this was. One of the worse films made of the year 2004. I see why this movie was a January release that year.

Ok, so I'm a 22 year old female who went to see this movie with a couple of my fellow college friends and I have to say, we were wonderfully entertained. The dancing was amazing and I have to say, the BEST part of the entire movie. There were moments when we just have to laugh at the horrible acting and delivery of lines by some of the actors as well as the random "rain sequence"; but it just goes to remind you what happens when you a music video director directs film. As a film student, I have to say that it was one of the worse shot films I have ever seen and that it should be used as an example in all film classes on how not to shoot a film. Besides, that, I still enjoyed the movie. There were times when I wanted to get up and dance with them, especially when Marques Houston started to popping, I only wished that I was right there in front of him popping right back. Overall, I liked the movie, it was entertaining in that I enjoyed the dancing and almost died laughing at the acting and filmmaking.

we are in a sad state of affairs when a movie like this can be #1 at the box office. topping even return of the king and mystic river. this only goes to show that the movie-going public are sheep and/or 15 year olds.

I understand the criticism that this film is not cohesive in it's plot or theme but when you take the movie for what it primarily is - a dance movie - it is excellent. If you grew up on Breakin' and Breakin' 2 and Beat Street, as I did, you understand that this movie is in the tradition of those movies. And as such it is an excellent dance film. The friendship story is OK and the romantic story is fine - and the dancing superb. Finally a movie about the street that can be watch by street youth with pride about their culture and lifestyle. To be honest, I am both discouraged and disenheartened that this movie has such a low score.

With that acting and that music.... all those twists and turns and the drama.... what a crime that this did not win best picture of 2004.... what were they thinking??..,,., haha JUST KIDDING...... this movie was soooo
Bad. But i fooled you

reviews.review_title: Good dancing . And thats about it
reviews.content:
This film is really just a badly acted , overlong music video with bits of A-B-C , 1-2-3 plotting and self explanatory dialogue thrown in.
The overall corniness of you got served ensures that the only enjoyment you'll get out of it is from the dance sequences which are excellently choreographed and well shot .These dances contain feats of acrobatics and contortionism that defy belief and will make your jaw drop to the floor.Apart from the amazing dance sequences though , there isn't much else to enjoy here unless you like poorly written and badly acted films .
Weak.

Let it be said again, the dancing in the movie was off the wall. That matrix thing at the end was bananas. I had to rewind it cause i didn't believe they did it without computers. But for the people who said its a great movie...you people are idiots. There is not chemistry between Omarion and that chic. The dialouge is sooooooooooo bad. I could honestly say its the wrokst dialouge i have seen in any move. Ever. The plot is weak. There are soooooooooo many holes. So much that just got left open. Omarion is possibly the worst actor ever. And u know that u suck if u cant even play yourself in a movie. Marques isn't bad and neither is J-Boog. I don't know if this movie deserves number three on the worst movies list cause the dancing was nuts, but it mos def sucked big time. If u people put this so high on the list, u gotta add Breakin' 2 Electric Bugaloo. They used special effects trick to make OZone dance on the ceiling. Pathetic. I think its safe to say that dance movies are pathetic. That goes for u too Honey.

There is no amount of words that can describe how painful it is to watch this type of movie, I remember watching it on DVD with my friend who thought it's a very good film (and bashing the acclaimed Open Water DVD that I just bought). To say the least this movie is like a waste of time, it's like watching something out of an MTV show with dance music and cardboard cut ups of actors and actresses playing the part. This was just atrocious. People may say that the dancing is good but for those who like dancing I guess that isn't enough to redeem this film's value. I'd rather have my eyes poke if someone asked me to watch this flick again, I'd rather watch Batman and Robin all year long than to watch this flick again. Together with most of the mainstream Philippine Films this crap should be banned in the future.

reviews.review_title: I no the acting ain't great but DAMN those people can dance
reviews.content: OK the acting is bad and has no storyline but to be honest i think they made the movie to show you some amazing dance moves. To be honest i didn't expect there to be good acting in it but i only watched the film for one reason and that is to look at the dance moves. I can't do street dancing but love watching the street moves. the people that have gave bad reviews probably don't even like dancing because if they did they would have at least given credit for the dancing. Also the music in it is so good. All the songs match the dances and are so catchy. If you like dancing and don't care about the acting watch it. You will be so amazed by the dance moves they produce.

I don't understand why everybody hated this movie so much. There were a few holes in the plot but it was a great movie. It might just be because i like break dancing but i think that even if i didn't like break dancing i would still love this movie. The movie's about these two kids who are best friends and who get mad at each other and then try to get back together to follow their dreams. I liked this movie so much that i bought the D.V.D.Overall this was an o.k. movie and even if it wasn't the BEST movie i don't think you guys should be criticizing it that much.7/10

reviews.review_title: Good for its time, but definitely doesn't hold up.
reviews.content: Dancing awesome. Drama and acting not so much.There is a "bad guy" in the movie that one of the main characters owes a bunch of money to. The whole movie leads to that dilema. Somehow Steve Harvey settles that issue and now the movie is back on track to dancing. ????? What?? That is the main thing that dropped this movie's rating. It wasted 30minutes of the viewer's time. They could have kept it so there was the usual beef between the dance crews. The big, scary, hinted at drug lord was not necessary.

reviews.review_title: I dared myself to watch this because of others' comments
reviews.content: SPOILERS included! I had a hankerin' to see why so many IMDBers came down so hard on this movie. Sort of like doing something you know you shouldn't, even if it was simply bad to waste one's time doin' it. I got the DVD from Cleanfilms.com, so I suppose I was spared a lot of crotch-grabbing (Some was left in the movie.) and bad language. At first, I didn't think I could take all the dancing the crews were doing. It seemed so repetitious. Here comes the spoiler... I thought during the competition for $50,000 at the end of the movie some of the dancing was good enough for me to hang in there till it was over. The acting was really bad, at first, but I think it improved as the movie went on, or I just got used to it. There is a plot, not JUST dancing. I wish I could have voted a 1.5, just because at the end, there were some new dance moves. By the way, I'm a 56 year old high school teacher who doesn't care for the way a lot of teenagers act. Oh... I'm white, Italian ancestry, and was surprised, in these politically correct times, to see that the main meanies in the competition where two white boys.

Possibly one of the most shameful representations of a generational fad ever. There's so much nonsense montages and b-roll to chew up the runtime. However, like looking at a pair of emo chain pants you used to wear, there's an awkward nostalgia flavor to this which keeps it from getting 1 star. I suppose "getting served" routines were big enough for that infamous South Park episode but geez Louise. There's something even worse than the dialog and the threads and that's the horrible self-indulgent Lil Kim cameo. I can't stand movies with celebs that are there just to fawn over them. Nah, just kidding.....the worst part is actually the bleached spiky hair that one guy has.

reviews.review_title: Plot wasn't that bad, but this movie was not made for a good plot
reviews.content: Only those who like dancing for the art would like this movie, this movie was not to be made for the acting, it was for the dancing, appreciate that aspect of the movie and you would enjoy it. The acting wasn't that bad anyhow, the plot was sketchy, but else can you incorporate into a movie about dancing. Look at Save The Last Dance, along the same plot, best friends break up, drive by's etc. The wost acting in this was by the character Wade and his patsy boy, but all the others were decent, and where else are you going to see Lil Kim in as much clothing as she was wearing ha-ha. Have an open mind when watching this movie.

The only good thing to come out of this film is the dancing in the very last battle. Apart from that the film is poor.If you are wanting to find BBoy action and great BBoy music then i suggest you check out the real thing. There are plenty of worldwide competitions that produce DVDs and some of the moves are for real and do not look remotely fake compared to this film. Some competitions to look out for are; 'UK BBoy Championships','Battle of the Year' and 'Freestyle Session'.Most films can be found on the internet so make use of google. Some DVDs to check out could be; 'The Freshest Kids' and some classics like 'Beat Street', 'Wild Style' and 'Style Wars'.As I was saying this movie is crap.

You Got Served isn't a masterpiece, but it was enjoyable. The dancing is absolutely mind-blowing, and the soundtrack is good, also. I would recommend it, but not if you're a hardcore cynic. It will make you want to get up and dance! 8/10

reviews.review_title: Acting is not required, Just Dancing.
reviews.content: You Got Served (2004) is a dance movie.  The producers are appealing to the teenage generation.  It lacks content and storyline.  But its movies like this will soar to the top the charts.  Well I wish the producers would take in consideration the amount of violence in this picture.  It doesn't set the prime example today for teens.  Next time push education and stop the violence.

This is a film with bad acting, stupid plot, terrible camera work, and is clearly just a promotional tool for these "actors." And yet, it is amazing. AMAZING. AM. AZ. ING. Of course, I'm lying. But the movie has a few amusing reasons to watch.For an example of the acting and camera work chops on display in this film, look no farther than the scene with David and his girlfriend at a diner. She has an extended monologue, but the camera repeatedly cuts to David reacting to her. Instead of simply shooting the shot so it could have the semblance of an actual conversation, we are given about ten reaction shots of David not saying anything. And I mean that in the literal and figurative way, since he does not speak and translates nothing through his "acting." The dancing scenes were pretty funny to me, but I don't give a sh*t about group dancing. Maybe they were really good. All I know is that I couldn't tell which dance group was better until the crowd applauded for them at the end of the competitions. And I could only tell then because Steve Harvey would tell us who got the louder applause. There is a character in the movie that is supposed to be a total dance master, but doesn't compete anymore, because he's all about the "art." Now, of course, he has to dance at some point to show off how awesome he is... but I honestly could not tell him apart from any of the other dancers.I also liked the frequent references to doing things "street." Whenever a dance was allowed to be "street," or no-holds-barred, it looked a lot like all the rest of the dance routines. I guess "street" means "heavily choreographed." Or maybe "street" is referring to the language in the movie. There are several moments where a character makes a pretty lame remark and everyone on the set reacts like the speaker was on Def Comedy Jam. The phrase "oh, snap!" would be fitting in most of these cases.What would have made this movie better would have been legitimate actors. Just imagine what this movie would be like if you replaced B2K with members of Kenneth Branaugh's Shakespeare films. Sure, the movie would have still been bad and had a dumb plot, but you would have gotten to see Denzel Washington and Keaunu Reeves doing MTV dance moves. And Jeremy Irons could play Steve Harvey's character! That would have been awesome!

I loved 'You Got Served'. I'm a massive R&B fan so it is probably easier for me to immediately like this film. I think Chris Stokes just wrote this film, went to studios and then BAM B2K were in on it and it went from there. As some have said the acting leaves a lot to be desired. Jennifer Freeman and Marques Houston and Steve Harvey are the only half decent actors in this.Why oh why does Lil Kim have to be in this film? She frightens me so much. She wears no clothes, has no figure and is as scary as Sly Stallone's mother Jackie.All in all I loved the film for the dancing, some acting and songs. The soundtrack is banging.

reviews.review_title: get this out of the bottom 100
reviews.content: the main reason i'm voting on this movie is because i was saddened to see it in the bottom 100, OK, for acting ability and actual plot line maybe you'd be right, but are you trying to tell me you were not entertained throughout this movie. 95% of this film was dancing, the choreography was beyond, (usher eat your heart out.) it was high energy and excitement and every person i know who's seen this love it for what it's about. my advice would be to check it out if your a dance fan you will not be disappointed. as a review it stars omarion from b2k and marques houston who together are in a hip hop dance team going up against the best the neighbourhood can offer, with their own flavas battle it out underground 8 mile style. after a night of humiliation when losing to a rival act an opportunity presents itself to hit back in a competition to win 5,000 dollars. when the main two fall out, the team must pull them together if they have any chance of capturing their dreams. A+

Absolute Rubbish.  Sorry, but this film is offensively bad.  It plays to stereotypes created in film almost a hundred years ago, where African Americans were relegated to three roles:1. Comic Relief 2. Domestic Helpand you guessed it:3. Crazy DancersThis film should have been a documentary about actual performers, in their element, but draws plot elements from such fine motion pictures like "Electric Boogaloo".  If you feel compelled to throw $10 away to see a movie this weekend, come to my house, we'll watch "Empire Strikes Back" and give me the money.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest hip hop movies ever made
reviews.content: There have been made many dance-movies through up the years like Flashdance, Dirty dancing and Saturday night fever, but there haven't been made many movies that are reflecting to hip hop. You got served is the movie hip hop dancers have been waiting for. The movie is about two friends, David and Elgins who leads the best dance-crew in the area. But one day when a white dance-crew challenge them to a battle, David and Elgin have to do everything they can to still be the best hip hop crew in the area.The leading roles is played by Marques Houston and RÅB-singer/dancer Omarion. They do a really good job in they're roles. All the actors in the movie looks convincing in their parts. The movie also features very cool hip hop songs created by the B2K group.The dance routines in the movie is so amazing that you have to see it to believe it. This is THE best hip hop movie ever created, and probably one of the greatest dance movies too.

reviews.review_title: I could watch this all day.
reviews.content: This movie was the most extraordinary thing I have ever witnessed in my entire life. Movies that have have more dancing than acting are not usually called movies but instead dance recitals, however, this is an exception. It reminded me of when I was 10 years old and my little sister had a dance recital and all my relatives came in and everyone was so proud. It was a great feeling, sort of like how Christmas feels.Long story short, check this movie out. You may forget it is a movie because there are no real actors in it and no plot either, but just forget all that. There's a whole lot of dancing, and sometimes that is what life is all about.

reviews.review_title: Dancing was phat, thats about it.
reviews.content: What I hear from critics on this board and everyday teenagers about this movie the two group's answers are a lot different. People who are on the internet judge this by it's poor attempt at an inspirational plot, bad acting and corny cliché dialog. The casual teenage group really enjoy this because they do not look closely for it's many flaws but instead pay close attention to it's "in your face" (Well what it tries anyway) attitude and the way these street wise locals can bust-A-move. This tends to fool them and makes the story seem more realistic and more interesting then it really is. Grossing less than 50,000,000 smackers in theaters worldwide this film would have been a bomb if it had a higher budget than the pitiful 12,000,000 it went on.Basic story, A couple of homies with their own high profile underground dance group find themselves in situation when their hustled out of $5,000 after a former member of their group betrays them. Already long time delivery boys of a black mob lord their friendship takes a turn when one of them accidentally blows off the other while out with his sister. Forcing to deliver the goods himself he is mugged and stripped of all of it. Now the rest of the group and some friends must try to get these two tight to win a "big bounce" competition for $50,000.Don't be fooled by what some people say, the dancing can be extremely entertaining. As said above the story, characterization, acting and dialog tries to fit in with all the hip hop attitude and just ruins itself on that note. It doesn't deserve the abuse it has received but just don't expect something too intelligent.

It has been said enough in the comments about acting v dancing in the movie. I do believe that the plot (super-predictable) and the acting (everyone talks like they read from the script) really disintegrate toward the second half. I enjoyed the dancing, even though with my 2 left feet I cannot really judge it--but my wife (a former ballerina) was impressed (nevertheless thinking that the film was god-awful overall).However, one point that has not been made is that the film was not meant to be an artsy one, or an Oscar vehicle. Instead, it is directed to black teens and pre-teens and the filmmakers tried to put as many positive messages as possible into the movie.The characters explicitly say on the screen: don't cuss, train hard, go to school, don't put your hands on the girl, don't get involved with crime... etc etc. One poster complained about the violence--but come on! It's an extremely watered-down picture of life in the 'hood. I would rate this movie a PG, not even a PG-13. While the plot line is a knockoff from 8-mile, its closer comparison is Sesame Street! If you are a movie buff, it's easy to dislike the film, but movies like this should be made, and I am all too happy to see it do well at the box office.

Movies that lean on gimmicks to be sucessful never are. The gimmick in this movie is dancing, along the lines of the 80s cult hit Breakin'... but this movie suffers from the same fate as it's older brother. The producers of this film didn't bother to check if their dancers could actually act. They can't. The dancing is actually interesting, but it loses its effect after the opening act.I can't tell you much of the plot because I walked out halfway through, but I do remember it involves betrayal and $10,000. All very hackneyed.There are those out there who think if you don't like this movie you have some negative racial motivations. I would respond by saying the white guys in this movie are more painful to watch acting than anyone else.

reviews.review_title: IF THERE EVER WAS A POS FOR A FILM, THIS IS IT!!!
reviews.content: Zero acting, the plot or story was crap...! The acting, everything about this if you can call it a movie was absolute CRAP!!! There was nothing good about it, nothing! Your typical yoin and illin! Did you ever encounter a moment in time where you saw something and you wish you could un-see it!!! Or if you hit delete on a computer to delete something from it's memory???!!! Well THIS IS IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Don't watch this crap or you'll be heading for the bathroom to vomit in the toilet! You have been warned!

This isn't Doctor Zhivago, this isn't even Lord of War. If you came looking for a hard hitting drama about the tough streets of the USA and they use dance to stay alive...pack up and go home now. This is Top Gun, this is House Party, this is FUN. These boys cant act, they cant sing and they cant carry a story but they can dance the bones out of a def beat. There is a primal instinctive beat that lives inside us, the heartbeat, this movie tunes into that and says, "if I had a steady rhythm and all the energy in the world, how could I use my body to show how happy I was?" I think these boys answer the question well, now I haven't see Stomp the Yard but now and again you need to get off your "Movies are like Greek Statues" high horse and learn to dance some freestyle. I am a club dancer and a ballroom dancer and I can recommend this movie to any other true dancers.

First off, who told these rappers they could act? These people in this movie have about as much talent as most of the people in the super bowl show! Lets get some real actors and some real writers out there!!!  This movie is beyond horrible!

To it's credit, the dancing in this film is amazing, but it doesn't make up for how bad it really is. The plot is predictable, the acting is sloppy, the writing is beyond lousy and the editing is all over the place. This film focused more on choreography rather than trying to create a decent film. The only people who "Got Served" are the ones who had to watch this.

reviews.review_title: You will like this movie if you aren't a lame white person
reviews.content: No idea why this movie is rated so low...the dance battles are great and its a classic street dance movie that paved the way for much bigger movies like Step Up. If you are in your mid 20's and have no rhythm and listen to country music, this movie isn't for you. Just search up You Got Served dance battles on YouTube and you will see its mostly positive reviews by young adults/teens who know this movie is fun.

reviews.review_title: The dancing was cool but the plot wasn't.
reviews.content: I saw this movie yesterday and I have to say that this is a "fairly" entertaining movie.  The acting wasn't that great but those of you who like "street dancing" I would say see it for the dancing.  There are very electrifying moves, some of the moves look unreal as if they were on wires or something.  But if you're looking for a decent plot, this is definitely NOT the movie for you.  But I feel the dancing scenes will keep you into the movie.

I was embarrassed when I asked the clerk at the video store if he had this movie. But me and my friend wanted to see what all the hype was about, after this got the #1 spot on the worst 100 list. Is it the worst movie of all time? No. Is it a bad movie? Absolutely. The film starts with a long dance scene and takes a while to get to any dialouge. All the dance moves are similar, and all seem extremely, for lack of a better word, ''flamboyant''. The camera work is nauseating, most of the shots were awful, and a lot of the time the camera just spun around, giving me a headache. There are a few good acting performances, but they were out shined by the razzie worthy acting, that the majority of the cast gave, in particular Christopher Jones, the leader of the O.C. crew, who's performance is so awful that it isn't even laughable, and is just downright annoying. The awful screenplay, done by the films director, Christopher B. Stokes, must have been a pain to spell check since every other word is, ''dat'', ''dis'', or ''y'all''. Stoke's characters are incredibly shallow, so it's hard to feel any emotion for anyone in the film, when Lil Saint was shot to death, I laughed out loud. All the characters are disgraces to their respected (our previously respected) races. The films only redeeming quality is, that it is funny for all the wrong reasons. If you and you're friends are looking for some good laughs, I would recommend this as a rental. I give it a 4/10.

reviews.review_title: You Got served. Man did it suck.
reviews.content: I thought the moive was brutal, the plot was weak and predictable. The acting by B2K was nothing short of crap, overall don't bother to waste your money on this piece of rubbish. I give this movie 1/10 stars, it's to bad I couldn't put in 0/10, because that's what it really deserves.

I don't think this movie was bad at all, i thought marques Houston and the boys from b2k were quite good at acting in it for I'm guessing there first film. You got served was never shown at the cinemas in england but i had been dying to see it because i like them even though they also ain't that heard of over here. The main part of film is obviously about the dancing and they do some really good battles, i am bad at dancing so i just sat there like wow. The story line wasn't all bad either, basically about an over protective brother having too much pride to go back on his angry words. It includes some big names like Lil Kim, Steve Harvey and choreographer wade Robson and Jennifer freeman from my wife and kids. If you like this kind of dancing and urban music you will like this film, it has a great soundtrack with music from b2k mainly, jhene, marques Houston, atl etc. Enjoy!

What's wrong with you people? This is one the best movies out there. So what if the plot isn't exactly the most realistic? It's as realistic as those of many other movies. Movies are meant for entertainment. This was more than entertainment for me... it was inspiration. The dancers in this movie are so talented. This movie combines comedy, drama, and dancing. How can you not love it? I've watched this about 4 times. I just want to watch it even more every time I watch it. I love this movie. It makes you want to dance no matter how bad you might be. There's so much energy in this movie. I usually feel lazy after watching movies. After watching this one, however, I was just so pumped up. Plus, Omarion is so cute!!
Lil kimmmm but seriously the acting was bad with the main characters and the story plot was lost somewhere.

A complete waste of film. They should collect every copies of this horrible piece of garbage and burn them so that this terrible, soul-sucking piece of crap cannot infect future generations. Anything with Kevin Federline in it should realistically be burned anyway. But this incredible sh!t-fest pushed the envelope even when it comes to Mr. Britney Spears. All of the people who had anything to do with producing this movie should feel terrible shame. They should all return any money that they received or give it to charity. I could go on. I could give you my take on the plot, the characters, etc. but thinking about the movie actually makes my head hurt. The kind of hurt where you'd like to pull your eyeballs out and spray novacaine directly onto your cerebelum. If you liked this movie, you should seek psychological help.

reviews.review_title: This movie was more about the dance
reviews.content: I give it an 8 simply because it conveyed a part of street dance that most movies (including Honey) couldn't do. It gave future dancers a platform of what to look when they feel like picking up some moves. The movie itself relates more to dancers than to non-dancers who only went to see the movie for a plot. As a dancer, I knew the plot would suck, but the dancing was outstanding. Most of these guys had never acted before this so let's cut them some slack. The movie is 2 years old and STILL it's being referred to when talking about some of the best dance movies of all times. It even surpasses Save The Last Dance and that movie actually had trained actors in it and it still managed to suck big time.

The reason i say this is because, in my opinion, on video you can fast forward fast enough and trust me it is needed in this film. Just watch the dancing a boy you will be impressed it is bad ass! A friend of mine got it on DVD because, as a dancer, he wanted to see what it was made of. He is the most critical person of films and as you could expect he ripped the acting and directing to shreds (too right!) but the dancing, ah, his jaw was dropped! I totally agree with him. I now turn to my vote. Imagine, if you will, that the film is split like so; 1)acting, directing, editing and lighting (5) 2)Dancing and soundtrack (5) There we are half marks (for the dancing in case you weren't sure). Frankly id much prefer to think that the voting was all for the dancing and forget that anything else even figured then it would get a 9. If you are a fan of hip hop and break dancing, body popping, krumping etc then you will love the dancing. If only they had cut out all the other stuff it would be great. Thank God its on DVD cause now i can skip to the good scenes and not want to hide my self with shame wasting time watching what can only be described as a less than immature production. Next time just go to LA and film real crews on the streets (the acting will probably be better).

reviews.review_title: One of those underrated movies with bad reputation cause of inexperienced voters
reviews.content: If I can't stand gory films I'm not gonna watch em...If I don't like comedies I'm not going to watch it...This movie is About DANCE...the main point is DANCE, the experience lies in the DANCING. This movie wasn't good but far from bad too, the script isn't original and it's flawed but who cares? Half of the movie we enjoy nice dancing and music and by seeing this movie it should be as you expected...If anyone thinks it's boring...well then they simply don't like dancing and why go and rate the film? I suggest that if you want to see this you better like dancing and hip-hop and then surely...it will be pretty fun and nice to watch

To all ya'll peeps who did not like this movie.....what is wrong wit ya'll!!! i might be a white gal from S.A but i love hip hop and the dancing that comes wit it!! OK maybe the acting wasn't off the chain but come on the dancing was BRILLIANT!! which of all ya'll peeps can dance like that????i thought so....not many!!that requires a sh*t load of practice and skill!!if ya'll are not into that hip hop dancing stuff then why did u go c it??duh!! This movie has inspired me 2 follow my dream and that is 2 dance!!i already do Spanish dancing and gonna start hip hop and Latin American soon!!ill be famous....very famous and when i do a movie like dis 1 day ill be smiling at ya'll wit all the money ill be making....ha ha ha ill be living my dream!!! David and Rico r the hottest things you'll ever find!!i had 2 watch the movie 11 times jugs 2 study those dance moves and see those gorgeous faces on my TV!!!!

I belive I have seen this movies before... wait, I have. In "Drumline", "Bring It On", and others. Except, those were classics. This is movie is terrible. The plot can't get much more simplier. Two friends have a dance crew where they compete to win cash. They've won every competition, but then some white boys come up and take their title. So, they have to do to a type of "Bring It On" competion for a 50,000 dollar prize. In the middle of this they producers thought they had to throw in some BS that had to make us try and feel sorry for the characters. And some how, don't ask me how, all their problems dissapear and... well you know how it goes. The acting is terrible. It seems to me, even the title needs some work. And the dialouge is real deep to like, "You suckas got seved", and "We gotta win, I'm tellin you man, we gotta for my mama". And that's about as deep as it gets.
