Don't waste your money on this, please I am begging you. Rent "Drumline", because it is a hell of a lot better. Sorry guys, but hott dancing can't even save this film.1/5

reviews.review_title: Only girls would like this movie
reviews.content: Well, Obviously guys don't like b2k so they won't like the movie and if they don't like b2k then why are they going to waste time watching it knowing that it would be a bad movie? I personally loved the movie.It has everything a good  movie should have and all the girls in the theater like it too. Why?Because it was a good movie and guys definitely don't like that movie because b2k is in it and that's probably why they are talking so much sh!t about it and thats lame and need to stop hating because that movie sold millions around the world. Anyway, You Got Served is about different crews that battle against each other in dancing street. And I dont want to give the movie away so if you haven't seen it yet see it because whoever said the money isn't worth spending...It is...

reviews.review_title: Its fun to look at, but not fun to listen to
reviews.content: You got served wasn't really meant to be an acting movie, it was more meant to show the art of dancing. You can't blame the creators, its hard to make a story about break dancing.Anyways the story is kinda boring to listen to.The best thing, well the only thing good about this movie is the dancing. Really great choreographed dance battles are really fun to watch and also make me jealous that i can't dance.The acting and story is horrible, but thats not what it was trying to show off.Dancing is really great

THis movie really isn't that bad.I did dancing in high school and this movie gave us great ideas The music went really well with the dancing The plot isn't the best but the dancing makes up for it I would say this is a good money to watch wit some people while chatting about it... even though in the movie theater the music with surround sound was really cool and feeling the base was really sweetI would say watch this movie and give it a chance if you like dancingI would say the acting is pretty bad in the movieGirls do look really good in the movieI hate this ten line thingThe plot doesn't really make senseThe final song is a great finisher You can't tell who really wins the battles

reviews.review_title: Easily the Best Movie Ever Made
reviews.content: This movie represents all that is good and righteous in our world today. Without these great actors, nay, GODS I would be a lost and wandering soul in the otherwise desolate expanse of "the hood." The servage per square inch in this movie was near INFINITY and some might argue that it has achieved a level that even the FDA wouldn't consent to.Basically, if you are unsure about watching this movie then you are a bigot. Great representations of our society don't come along very often and this film could symbolize everything we hold dear and true. When I wake up and go to school in the morning I say to myself, "What would Eljin do?" After that I roll roughly five feet on my head and start to spin like I was either on fire or having a seizure.I give "You Got Served" a ten out of ten, but that rating couldn't possibly do it the justice it really deserves.

i thought that the movie had some of the worst acting that i have ever seen. Rico (jarel houston) did a pretty good job but other then that the acting was ridiculous. i am glad that the boys could dance because thats all they had going for them in this movie. the girls were terrible. if i never see them in another movie it would be fine with me. if that girl said beautiful one more time i was going to hang myself. you would think that they would have had the sense not to cast her in anything else after biker boys but i guess not. that being said, i have watched the movie a few times since i bought it (i purchased it before i had seen it. give me a break, the trailers looked good) but i always skip over the dialog and go straight to the dance scenes. these are the only parts worth watching. overall, i would say that the acting sucks and the plot is predictable. the choreographer definitely gets two thumbs up though :)

I must disagree with many of the other users' comments. I admit the storyline does lack a certain originality to it..however this film is based around urban dancing...and considering that...IT DELIVERS. I know many of my friends who are into this style of dancing and this film has been an inspiration to them. The acting is mediocre - nothing that special...the chirography is pure bliss and you really get into the mood of the movie! Something which also has to be mentioned is the music, excellent choices made taking the best from hip-hop. I do however, believe that this film is probably not for the older generation...more suited for younger urban young adults who have an interest in hip-hop etc. Don't knock it before you've seen it...well worth the hour or so...

reviews.review_title: Did You Really Think It Was the Next "Good Will Hunting"?
reviews.content: When I first saw the previews for "You Got Served," warning bells went off in my head as soon as the word "B2K" was mentioned. In this day and age, the acting vehicles used by music entertainers to break into the acting business are less than satisfactory i.e. Britney Spears in "Crossroads" or Lance Bass in "On the Line."Already I knew the plot, as well as the acting, would be shoddy. I waited until my friends went to see "You Got Served" before seeing the flick myself. According to them, the dancing was amazing and "Wade," the evil white rich kid, was hot and that his hotness was enforced by his cocky attitude and lack of screen time. By dancing more than he spoke Wade endeared himself to them, unlike Omarion, whose hot dance moves were overshadowed by his awful acting and atrocious kissing skills. I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this film but I'm sure my enjoyment was thanks in part to my low expectations. If you watch this movie only expecting to see amazing dance routines, you'll probably enjoy it too. My friends and I just watched it again on DVD and fast forwarded through the entire thing, only stopping when Wade spoke and for the dance routines. As a movie "You Got Served" is subpar, but if you were in the mood to see some amazing dance movies then you should give this movie a shot.Just fast forward through the acting and you'll be fine.

Good all around dance movie that does not hold up very well after you see it because the story is not very good out side the dance numbers that surround the movie. B2K do well for this kind of movie but we have seen this plot before, and done much better than this.Wait for Video.

reviews.review_title: An inspiring, breath-taking accomplishment- destined to become a classic
reviews.content: What can be said (or cannot be said) about such a heartwarming work of cinema that has not already been translated to word(s) or speech. The frailty of the English language in describing the extremes of human emotions is epitomized in any description attempted in the feeling of awe and inspiration and enlightenment one receives after having viewed this grandiose tour de force. I'm not a man found weeping, in a widow's arms or in the bleakest of situations among the social safety of isolation, but tears of happiness were willingly elicited from my long-dormant tear ducts and flowed gracefully down my tender cheeks to the tip of my chin without feeling as though I needed to wipe away the evidence in shame. Strange feelings stirred within me, and like a lonely watchman guiding them up the dreary, rust-stained steps of a lighthouse with his bright oil lantern, these feelings unfurled and sprang up to the top like a thousand butterflies fleeting their cocoons, gasping for air and awaiting the various pleasures and freedoms of their new life. These feelings that I had known to be rotten and forever buried were resurrected by the overbearing impact of this film upon the human soul and spirit.

I just spent the past 20 minutes reading all your comments, and you people, well most of you, obviously, are not teens. This movie is particularly made for teens. This movie has dance moves that teens love, it has a popular boy band B2K, that teenage girls love. And I even read somewhere that someone didn't know what the phrase "You Got Served" meant. That makes it so obvious that you aren't from a place where people talk ghetto.Now back to the actually movie review, the movie was awesome, the acting was awesome, the plot was awesome. The whole movie was pretty much awesome. I mean I know that the movie doesn't apply to people over the age of 19-20. But you really shoudn't be critizizing it. You all may think that I'm a teen, and I am, I'm 13 and I personally really loved this movie.To me there are no spoilers in this movie! I do recommend this movie to anyone who is a fan of B2K's, or likes dance moves. To Chris Stokes: Great Job on this movie! Thank You very much for making a movie really applies to people living in rich areas, so they can see how people in ghetto areas talk and do things.

It seems that every generation has its "dance" films, "You Got Served" is following in a long line of films that throughout the celluloid eras have tried to be of a certain "moment" and "style".And style it has. And charms too thanks mostly to its winsome and attractive leads. The dancing is beyond keen and is entertaining in itself.I'd like to think of "You Got Served" as more this era's "Breakin" than "Body Rock". Hopefully the warm nostalgic glow that surrounds "Breakin" will envelope a film like this too.Is it a good film? To a certain age level it will be and thats what counts.One thing that these youth oriented "of the moment" films do that amuses the heck out of me is they strip the edginess out of said thing so that its palatable to even the most restrictive burgs and towns. Its always a hoot to me to have the "edgy" dances or "lingos" grafted with tried and true gooey wholesomeness...such a scene occurs in this film when young lovers are sharing a malted at a local sweet shop as if in a Sandra Dee film of yore.... :o)

I agree with you bob. The acting in the movie was BAD.However, you kept bringing up that this and that is so clichéd but fail to realize that it's all apart of a lot of some people's everyday life. Yes, there are kids who really sell drugs to get by and kids who speak a lot of Ebonics and kids who get killed just for being in the wrong place at the wrong time.Also, I don't know exactly what you're trying to get at when you say "clowning type of dancing" because just like any other top of dance, hip hop and break dancing is and art form. Besides the stars in the movie they brought truly talented kids from off of the streets. Like most people i know(including myself) the kids from the movies don't need dance lessons they are born with the talent of the level of dance they do. I bet you couldn't do what they do what they did.I didn't agree with what you said about Steve Harvey being the "big guest star" . You said it like it was a joke and I actually think he was the best actor out of the whole movie . The movie was made to appeal to younger audiences and fans of b2k. Even though I agree with some of the things you said, i don't look at the movie as a piece of exploitation to the black race. The acting in the movie was bad but the plot is real life and happens everyday. Just because you were married to a black woman does not mean you know everything about the culture and just because you live another life that you may think is better does not give you the right to criticize someone else's because you haven't lived that experience and wouldn't know why their life may be the way it is. I do appreciate you trying to defend something you thought was wrong and had to do with race. Chris Stokes wasn't lazy in writing he just didn't know what he was doing because he is just a Manager not a Producer like he tried to be. I just hope next time you dig deeper into something before you publicly discuss it.

This movie's plot scales from awful to average. Like its acting does. This movie should have been shorty with a documentary style...would have been much better than this.This is not a good dramatic movie or whatever you can call it, but I think it is a masterpiece of a dance movie. I mean, cut the story out and just leave the dancing scenes and this movie is really amazingly great. I mean, I was watching like "wow, how did he do that?...look how he moves!". For all you interested in modern hip-hop style dancing this is a must see. Good for lessons too, just forget about the story, enjoy the dance stuff.

reviews.review_title: Shake it like a salt shaker
reviews.content: THE SCOOP: You see them all over the streets,crowds gather to cheer and scream for their favorite crew locked into battle with their formidable crews.With unbelievable raw talent and explosive moves they defy gravity and spin to the rhythmic sounds of urban music.David and Elgin are the best of friends and their "crew"is unstoppable.But when a huge challenge comes from another crew out of town,David and Elgin are forced to come up with the most cutting edge moves that are mind blowing and pumped up in order to stay at the top. But with double-crossing friends and personal intentions,its not gonna be easy and they'll have to come together as one for the ULTIMATE BATTLE! OK first things first...this is not a good MOVIE. But lets not go criticizing them for something these people were not trying to do OK? They were definitely not making a "MOVIE". This movie was always gonna be about hip-hop straight street freestyle bad ass dancing.And for that...this movie most definitely hit the SPOT! The dance moves portrayed in this movie was absolutely magnificent! If you are looking for a good MOVIE don't even bother renting it cos its a waste of your time and money.But the dance moves in this movie is absolutely sublime! But don't get me wrong...the plot and the scripts were not good enough to wipe your bottoms with.BUT MAN CAN THEY DANCE!! full marks for the dancing and maybe one mark for the story.Final Say: IF u like dancing,bump bump bumps,and rock solid moves to get you on the dance floor....FIRST CLASS CHOICE!

Innocently I sat, waiting for the previews to finish and the movie to start, not knowing the previews were by far the best entertainment of the evening. Once the lights dimmed, it didn't take long to realize I'd wasted my money. Not only did I waste it, I did it in what is arguably the most painful of fashions. I would have been better off if I'd paid the same amount of money to let a pack of rabid wolves gnaw my limbs off - at least the agony would have ended sooner. If my date hadn't been committed to seeing the thing through (`we paid for it, we may as well see it') I would have walked out, but no.. The things we do for those that we for love.At one point I wanted to take a ball point pen and jam it into my eyeball, then pound it as deep into my skull as it would go. I would have then smashed my head face first repeatedly into the back of the seat in front of me until rendered duly unconscious so as to escape the agony of this retch-fest, but alas, no pen. I tried to borrow one from any other patrons in the theater, but wisely, they had all fled. I could only pass the time with idle dreams of listening to my Walkman while strolling down a set of railroad tracks.Save your self the pain I went through, and avoid this flick.

reviews.review_title: Another sign that Western civilization has already passed its cultural pinnacle.
reviews.content: Let me start off by saying that this movie contains some of the most creative and mind-blowing dance sequences I've ever seen. I'm not a big fan of dancing, but even I was floored by the awesome kinetic impact of the choreography. There were no special effects assisting the dancers, but many moves seemed like they belonged in the Matrix.This is where my praise ends....The rest of this heap of tripe seems like it was written by 13-year-olds FOR 13-year-olds. 13-year-olds with ADD that is. I would really like to meet the producers who read this script and said "Yup, looks good to me, here's 15 million dollars." Between the numerous pointless plot developments (I use the word 'plot' loosely), all the loose ends, the confusing editing, the abysmal acting and the anti-climactic ending, this film...er, movie....is just one big mess. It's crap like this that makes our youth look like slobbering inbred idiots. I need to wash my brain.

a bad movie is a bad movie.  no one should feel bad for anyone involved in this piece of work.  the producers knew exactly what they making when the $8 million dollar budget was hooked to it.  they also knew exactly who they were marketing it to.  no one should say, "well, the dancing was good, so i give it a 8!"  i don't know many people who watch bad films but rate them high because the costumes are well made.  a bad movie is a bad movie. don't make excuses for them. the producers shot for a target market, and hit it. but they should be ashamed for making such a low quality film just because they knew kids could get $10 to $15 dollars from mom and dad to throw at the box office.  the producers and filmmakers don't owe us a good attitude or friendly smiles but they do owe us their best work, and i have a tough time believing that this film represents their best work.  it plays more like a last ditch attempt to draw attention towards b2k and imx, who no one cares about anyway.

reviews.review_title: 2 guys trying to get recognised for their talent of good dancing
reviews.content: you got served ,i find, is one of the best films I've watched in a very long time. the Choreographer did an excellent job teaching all the dance moves because they were so great that me and a couple of friends decided to buy you got served take it to the streets and since then we have been learning all the dance moves. the film is a bit like honey in the sense that they are dancing and trying to make it happen for themselves as either a career or a way to earn money. i think the director did a really good job putting former members of b2k and marques Houston into the film. it has put all of them into a real good start in the acting business. i really enjoyed the film and i hope the director would think about making a you got served 2.

After reading some reviews about this movie I was in no way planning to go and pay to see it, however one of my friends had it on DVD so I decided to borrow it and see for myself. What I found was a very thin plot and some terrible acting but some incredible dancing thrown in at times. I'm sure it was only the dancing that kept me watching all the way to the end and actually enjoying it and for this reason I gave it a 5 out of 10. For the most part it did not matter about the poor acting and script because this film (I'm sure) was made purely to entertain people and the dancing definitely did that. However, when there was supposed to be some serious/emotional acting, I found it almost unbearable to watch.Comparing this film to "Honey", which was also mainly about dancing, although the plot and acting in Honey wasn't amazing, it was much better than in You Got Served. This is why Honey received higher ratings overall although the dancing in YGS was actually better (in my opinion). Basically if you start to watch this movie with the mindset that it will be entertaining if you like to watch hiphop dancing but not expecting a high level of acting or a good script, you will enjoy it a lot more than if you are expecting an emotional and moving piece of drama.Overall - average

reviews.review_title: Great Dancing Is All It's Got
reviews.content: Dancing has reached a new level in this movie. The moves are probably commonplace to the club set but it was great to have them performed in my living room. I just had a problem with the plot. One more time, inner city kids are struggling to get "out" (of Baldwin Hills ?!?!?) and their only opportunity is through dancing, with a little drug trafficking on the side. None of these guys worked or went to school during the course of the movie. All they did was dance, move drugs, or play basketball; nice play on stereotypes! This movie had a lot of aggressive energy that was somewhat unnecessary and values I wouldn't subscribe to in my family, but, I'd watch it again though because the dancing is HOT!

Hello. I figured I had to write something because of all the people who reviewed the movie and said that the dancing, as well as the acting, was horrible. Well, yes, the acting was atrocious. But you have to give them credit for focusing on the dancing, of which they did an awesome job. For everyone who said the dancing sucked, I would like to see them try the routines that those people in the movie were pulling off so easily. Dancing, especially the hip-hop break dancing stuff they were doing, takes hours of practice and a great amount of effort. It is their job to make it look easy, because it really isn't. Don't criticize something until you have done it yourself, and have experienced how very challenging it is.

The only intense emotion i felt about this film was the desire to perform an emergency blood pressure decrease via the arteries in my wrist."A film about dancing!" they thought "That'll be amazing!!!" No, just no.Thats all you need to know about this film, no "strong language", no "sex/nudity" just plain old-fashioned intense emotions just like my momma used to have.Reviewed in one word: Lacking .....emotional intensity, i'll give those studio execs intense emotions all the way to the bank, i don't know where i'm going with this but i just hate the film sooo much. i ain't even watched the damn thing, i just saw the advert 60 times.If you want intense action watch A Beautiful Mind, if you wanted comedy watch Sophie's Choice and if you want Drama watch Weekend at Bernies 2 but please just do not watch this film.Fin.

First of all I don't know why this movie got so many bad reviews.It has good acting,great feuds and an awesome story.When El and D split up i was kind of freaked out because I didn't know if they were going to get back at those OC punks or not.Then when Lil Saint died I thought i was going to cry. The movie is just great I wish more movies were like this one.This movie and Ladder 49 are my favorite movies I have seen in about 3 years.This is just my opinion though. I guess you guys/girls don't agree with me, but i would recommend anyone to see it.10/10 for me.

reviews.review_title: This is a bad movie, but yes, it gets a 9 out of 10.
reviews.content: You have to know what you're getting into with this movie. I'll break it down for you in 3 simple steps:1. The acting is horrible, with no exceptions 2. The battle dance scenes are amazingly entertaining 3. The unintentional comedy rates a perfect 10 out of 10When channel surfing, I will always stop on You Got Served, it cracks me up. You know how you can watch a good movie and notice something new to like about it every time? That's exactly how this movie is, except replace the words "new to like" with "that doesn't make sense". It's almost as if the screenwriters sat down with the expressed purpose of audience confusion.David is old enough to drive a car? His high school-aged girlfriend is actually a nurse who's going to college? One of his guy friends calls and he answers like it's a phone sex hotline?An added bonus was Marques Houston on MTV Cribs, he had the movie's poster framed in his living room. Pausing by it mid-tour, Marques looked up with deep, Raging Bullesque reverence, and said, "...and this is the film I was a part of, You Got Served."All of this makes the movie near unwatchable, but that's the genius of it, because it's so bad that it's good. Do yourself a favor, watch it, and afterward turn to your friends and say, "Tonight, YOU suckas got served."

If you'V seen the movie then, you have to agree. He is fine. Especially since he can move to. It starts out as Elgin and David, ( Marques and Omarion ), battle some crews and have a winning spree. Then, Wade and his boy challenged them to a battle. They have to put up 5 g's. They lose the battle cause their boy Sonny sold them out. They decided to make up for the battle by delivering money from Emerald to a client. David was too busy having fun with Liyah, (Jennifer Freeman), and forgets to hook up with Elgin. Liyah turns off D's phone. When D looks out the windows and see that it's dark he gets a call saying that Elgin's in the hospital. He rushes there and El's disgusted with him. Liyah has secretly meet with David and they hug and talk. El finds them and pushes Liyah away. David gets mad and punches El. After that, El meets Emerald and he tells him that he has a couple of weeks to get the money back. El and D practice for the Big Bounce. D and his team screw up while, El does a great job. Liyah and Rico come over to resolve the problem, but they are still mad at each other. In the end, they get a tie and they have to battle it out. El and David pull it back together and battle. Doinging a fantastic job and beating Wade. I thought they should'V let El dance more. D hooks back up with Liyah with El's permission and the story goes on cause they're filming a sequel to the movie!

reviews.review_title: don't watch it for the script
reviews.content: After reading the last summary of this movie, i'm not shocked by the review ... however it did leave one crucial point out which i will get to later.Yes the script and acting is shocking, and I agree that the actors try too hard with their acting, and their are serious plot holes. The story is rushed and a lot happens in a short period of time which at times makes it a little confusing. However the one good thing in this film is the battles, some of which are not fully choreographed, but all of which make you want to be there in the crowd watching them happen. In the final part of the movie Lil Kim, Wade Robson and Lala make cameo appearances which do little to add to the quality of acting, but make Omarion and Marques Houston's acting look good.In short don't rent or buy this movie for the script, but do buy it for the dance sequences. It is a welcome addition to any movie collection.

Wen the movie first came out I heard it was suppose to be a B2K movie! I was mad that Fizz, Boog, and Raz had small parts and the movie was mostly about Omarion and Marques. The movie was good though, I LOVED the dances and some parts were funny. There was some parts that really work my nerves a lot cause they tried SO hard to make it seem like it was hilarious when it really wasn't.. But other then that, I give this movie an 8 out of 10 because of the hot dances and some of Dar funny parts... O yea.. And for giving Fizz that cute name.. Rashaun 8^) :)!!!~KeeKee ~Mz Smith

The dancing was actually pretty good, and when I watched this movie (about two-three years ago) I was actually impressed with it. Its not a complete waste of your time and worth the watch if you're just bored one day and you feel like watching something you've never seen.Its NOT bad. The acting /may/ leave a bit to be a desired, but the plot isn't bad and these guys are amazing at what they do. Some of the stunts they pull are funny or just make you go "Wow, I wish I could do that."Give it a shot.Don't listen to all of the bad reviews, and don't let them bias your opinion. Just watch the movie and let your own mind decide if you like it or not.

I love to dance and when i watch dance movies I expect to see well choreographed dance moves and a lot of them. Some movies like Billy Elliot for instance, did not show any dance moves at all. Yes, the story was complex, but the "dancing" that a dancer expects when watching a "dance" film was not there. That's what you call an awful dance movie.You got Served, served its main purpose which is to show "dancing", just like it is. A person does not go and watch a dance movie expecting for an Oscar Awarding masterpiece. Yes, it is possible to do that, but if the dance movie is of a "lighter" kind, JUST CHILL AND ENJOY WILL YOU. Quit being so uptight.If you don't like dancing, that's your problem. Don't take it out on this movie. That way, you won't have to make such awful comments about the movie and ruin it for dance enthusiast who want to learn from professionals. Dancers dance- so just enjoy the dancing when you watch, will you?

In my opinion, you shouldn't watch this movie for the story. Both the story and the acting are horrible. Flat characters, a simple story etc etc. It doesn't matter what kind of movie you apply this formula to, the result is always the same: the story is merely an excuse to put the "goodies" on screen. In an action movie there'll be a simple story to justify the shooting/violence/martial arts/whatever, in this movie the story justifies the dancing.If you are going to watch this movie, do so only for the dancing. Even though the dance scenes make up a relatively small portion of the movie, the quality is beyond doubt. After you've seen the dancing in this movie there's a good chance you'll find yourself trying to copy as many moves as you can. Acrobatics, popping, locking, "robotics", it's all there.Rent or buy this movie on DVD so you can skip from dance scene to dance scene because that's the only way to enjoy this movie. Watch the scenes, get inspired and start dancing! PS. the music during the dance scenes is great but they aren't included in the soundtrack, so check IMDb's "soundtrack" listing to find the quality songs.

reviews.review_title: The dancing makes the movie worth it
reviews.content: If you're not a dancer, don't like dancing, and don't like hip-hop music, this is not the movie for you. "You Got Served" has an after-school special feel to its plot. The problems and solutions, and particularly the dialog are simplistic. While the plot of this movie leaves a lot to be desired, the dancing makes it worth seeing again and again. The movie collects a huge group of talented dancers. The battle scenes in the movie are good enough to watch multiple times in a row. Actually, the movie runs a lot like an extended music video, the plot is simple and easily understood (it would even work without any dialog), and really great music and dancing. The movie is centered on hip-hop music and dancing, so those who do not appreciate this genre will not find much redeeming value in the flick.

This movie deserves a 10, so that is why I rated it so. There is no other place to experience the energy of dance battling like this movie presents. If you enjoy dance battles, this movie is for you. reviews.review_title: Horrible, horrible movie; great, great dancing
reviews.content: The script is the usual mass-produced dreck they have in this sort of movie, and the acting was as bad as you'd think, but the poor production values and wooden acting lead to plenty of unintentional humor, and the breakdancing is very well-choreographed and there is a lot of it.  On balance, this is a good movie, but only if you are like me in that you enjoy being ironic and flashy physical stunts.  Otherwise, you should probably stay away.

reviews.review_title: 'You Got Served' is undoubtedly a work of staggering genius
reviews.content: Where to begin? The only word I can think of to describe this movie is 'genius'. The cinematic references contained in this movie are ridiculous...Purely off the chain, as it were. The obvious connection to West Side Story stands out, but the films The Godfather, Amadeus, Seven Samurai, and of course the classic Bring it On are not forgotten. The acting in this movie was clearly superb. Clearly. And the script unbelievable. UNbelievable. I felt enthralled from beginning to end, from the introduction of the characters to the characters' strategic uses of the phrase 'Tonight, YOU got served'.Also, the connections between this movie and the wonderful television program 'Sister, Sister' are unbelievable in scope. First, Jackee Harry appeared in both productions, though her role in 'Sister, Sister' was much more revealing of her acting talents. Her smaller role in 'Served' took a backseat to Marques Houston's grade-A performance as Elgin, troubled teen and part- time 'server'. In short, this film will deliver. You will NOT be disappointed. RUN to your local video store to rent this gem, which is again a work of staggering genius.

reviews.review_title: Where I come from we call that a mistake

It's really a shame good IL John Wayne didn't live to teach these fellers a thinge er two about the movies, for instance, film is a valued thing and it should not be wasted. I think that what this movie could have used was an element that made it not look like a two hour muzak video. I've seen about every movie on the IMDb top 250 list and I think that this movie is totally a contradiction of what Francis Ford Coppola, Quentin Tarantino, and Akira Kurosawa have achieved over the years. As a final statement, I don't really know if this movie should be on the bottom 100 list because honestly I don't quite consider it a movie.

I am sorry that I wasted my time and money to watch this movie. Granted I was not expecting a cinema classic but a plot would have been nice. Let's give credit where credit is due though. The dancing one word......amazing. But that is where it ends. Watching this movie made me feel like I was taking a sightseeing tour with an ADD tourguide. One word for the writer of this movie......Ridlin. I hear it does wonders for your concentration. The plot had so many holes in it I wondered if Mr. Stokes kept forgetting that he was writing a movie. The main reason I watched the film is because I had heard that was unlike any other dance film out there. I mean come on how many other films have their actors dancing in the rain and water? Well let's see Flashdance, Footloose, Dirty Dancing, etc... And this movie had inner struggles for the characters just like EVERY other dancing movie. Warning spoilers ahead (Trust me, read the spoilers bypass the movie it will be a better use of your time). What I can't understand is how Elgin's sister got into Princeton yet she couldn't afford to go. Isn't her older brother the one that just came up with 5 grand to enter a dance challenge that they lost anyway? I mean come on, he doesn't even have a job. Except for dealing what I suppose are drugs (but we are not sure since Stokes never fully explained it) for a biggie wanna-be. And what about 'LiL' Saint. He gets killed while he is riding around with his friends and their car gets sprayed. The boy is like 8 years old. What 8 year old hangs around with kids old enough to have a car? Basically they just killed off a kid so they would have some reason for El and David to get back together to win the competition. Cause I could see no other reason for the two to ever remain friends. Call me crazy but if my friend leaves me high and dry and I get the snot beat out of me it would take more than dance competition for me to forgive him.All in all I will give this movie a 2 out of 10. Personally I would have rathered Mr. Stokes skipped the plot and just made a 2 hr music video because the dancing and the music is the only thing that helped this movie.

Well I'd have to say that as whole this film sucked. The plot was lame, the storyline was bad, the direction was awful, and the acting was probably the worst I have seen.I was particularly disappointed with the extremely wooden acting by Jennifer Freeman who usually does a great job as the older daughter Claire Kyle in "My Wife And Kids". In "You Got Served" she looked extremely uncomfortable playing the role of Liyah. It seems she is much better at playing a clean cut daughter of a suburban upper-middle class family, than the daughter of a working class single parent.However there is ONE reason why I would still go and buy this movie on DVD - the dance scenes. The choreography was off the hook. At the end of the movie, although we were totally bagging the film out ... my friends and I were pumped up enough to want to go find a club to have a dance battle in.I think I'd give the movie 1/5, and the choreography 5/5

reviews.review_title: YOU GOT SERVED IS AWESOME bi0tches
reviews.content: For those of you out there who said You Got Served is a horrible movie, you need to rethink your judgement. You Got Served, is like many said, a movie about cool music and dancing. But it DOES have a meaning to it. You Got Served inspires you to go out and try a new hobby. You Got Served is great for relaxation. Most of all, You Got Served is a heartwarming movie about FRIENDSHIP. The story tells about a group of friends who share a same hobby (dance battling) and how they pull through hardships of living in the ghettos of California. The first difficulty comes with Sonny's betrayal, which puts a breach in their friendship. This loss of a friend causes them to do bad in the battle and lose $5k to Wade's Crew. Then David fails to meet Elgin about Emerald's drug run. Elgin ends up getting jumped and the two become upset at each other. Meanwhile, Wade's Crew is out winning battles, while the two separated friends go through hardships of their own. In the end, friendship pulls through and David and Elgin succeed in achieving their goals. How many times has friendship been underrated in our daily life? This movie teaches us to appreciate our friends, because if you don't, then you'll regret it when you lose them (RIP Lil'Saint). All of you who rated You Got Served a 1 need to go back and understand the true meaning behind the movie. FRIENDSHIP.

Soul Plane, the start is just unbelievable. his but gets stuck in the toilet and the flight attendant misses the button for the auto release. come'on. and lets say that can happen, how can a john doe, a normal man, open a plane industry with purple exteriors and hydraulics.but You Got Served, groups of mates showing off there dancing skills. thats what i call normal compared to the other movies. we've got a place like that in the Nothern Territory of Australia. reviews.review_title: The story sucks, The dancing rocks!
reviews.content: The story of You Got served is a masterpiece of crap. It's incoherent and note professionally written. The movie has no point at all and was made just to bring the dance moves to the screen without paying much attention to the script. As for the acting, it's mediocre regarding the fact that most of the cast are infamous or dancers. The direction is acceptable in the drama scenes and good in the dancing scenes. The choreographies were great and excellent as well as the dancers abilities and talents. Dave Scott and Shane Sparks made a lot of effort in the choreographies that managed to overcome the failure of the script. If there will be a sequel for you got served, they'd better produce a well-written script and good direction, not to mention better actors.

I'm not bagging on anyone, but I really liked the movie. These actors trained hard for this movie, and for it being a lot of their first movies, they did a really great job. But everyone has their own opinion. I just wanted to put mine on here. Many of you will disagree with me and that's fine, but it doesn't mean I'll change my opinion. I give mad props to everyone involved in this movie, I liked it, I would love a second one, even if I was the only one who went to see it. Well i can't wait to read all the replies to me about what a lunatic, with no taste I am! Again I LOVED it, even if no one else did!! Oh, and by the way, I am a huge fan of Marques Houston, and Omarion!!! But that's not the only reason I loved the movie, i also loved it, because it was the first really good dancing based movie I've seen that didn't revolve around cheerleading! THANK-YOU!!!

I Think this movie is rated 2 mostly because of the fact that the white guys are the bad guys. They are disrespectful and honor-less against their rivals. And they only win because of a traitor. Most of the viewers can't identify themselves with the "heroes" on the contrary they can't handle the fact that sometimes the white guy is the bad guy and the black guy is the good guy. "You Got Served" is an entertaining movie not a philosophical one. It's like SaturdayNightFever or similar movies. This movie is made for younger audience the so-called MTV-Generation. It is well performed and i like the music too. Its like "Drumline" with the speed of "Fast And Furious".

Honestly, the movie "You Got Served" gets a terrible rap and is at the but of tuns of bad movie jokes, but its not that bad. I happen to like the music, so thats a plus. There is plot, character development, a good soundtrack,and its a fun little movie. It has its niche in Hollywood and i think just because of the heavy slang and pop culture this movie gets its bad rap. Also, when I saw that this movie actually starred rappers like omarion and marques houston i expected terrible acting. The acting was definitely acceptable. I've seen many of the top two hundred and fifty movies and I also enjoyed this one. I don't think it deserves to be up there, but I also believe it doesn't belong down at the bottom one hundred.

OK OK, i agree that this wasn't the most perfect film i have ever seen. But there are faults with every movie! The fact is, you chose to watch this film, knowing it had black rapper dancers in... and if you thought it was going to be a romantic horror movie then you must have a few screws loose. Obviously if there are black celebrities in the movie there are going to be dialogue maybe you wouldn't necessarily come across, and the dancing isn't going to be that off 'top of the pops'. But face it... if you knew this about the film and yet still watched it, DON'T COMPLAIN! If your a middle aged man with on and off migraines, you're blatantly going to dislike this film. Just watch the trailers for f*** sake! So the next time you decide to sit down and watch a movie aimed at teenagers, with black rappers in, and knowing it contains several dancing scenes, don't bother expecting it to entertain you if your above the stage of finishing puberty! (unless going through a middle ages crisis, and are still 'young at heart') Thankyou, and remember WATCH THE DAMN TRAILERS FOR PAYING TO SEE A FILM!

1st of all I don't know why everybody's calling this the worst movie ever,because no one in their right mind would say this movie is as worse then stupid movies like The Grudge.The dancing is awesome, the acting is superior compared to movies: I know what you did last summer etc, and the actors aren't that bad but i've seen worse.This movie is easy to follow and is not as mindless as other dance movies like Honey which I thought was crap.Personally I love this movie and I think anyone whose says this movie is 1 of the worst movies ever made I suggest they watch sh**t movies like Signs, The Grudge, Crossroads, Honey etc. then you'll see You Got Served will clearly over rate crap movies like that.

It's always enjoyable to see young men, who have differences, and can agree to disagree. Friends maintaining respect & values despite the difference, I applaud this.The one thing I found of concern is all these kids who were of college age, what where they doing to be successful woman & men with an earning potential to support a quality life? Even pro-players value the education they receive in college or after their professional playing time is over.We've got to remind the youth that it is ALL possible. One does not have to sacrifice education to have fun or vice versa. Remind us of those who are and have done it - they're out there.Loved the battles! I look forward to seeing more from the actors as well as the writer/director!

Stokes' official response to the breakup is posted on the T.U.G. Entertainment website, expressing his "shock": "They are like my sons, and I can't understand how, or why they would do this, but if the boys can hear my voice now, I want them to know that I love them and I wish them the best. Plus, I am surprised because they are still under contract with me. I love all of you and all of the fans out there. Please pray for B2K." The statement is actually longer than this, but the line about the contract creeps in at the end, a detail that, oh dear, must have slipped the minds of his erstwhile son-like clients. (Omarion, for his part, has retreated from initial upset at the walk-out, telling MTV News he'd like to "get back together" with the others, following his solo projects, because "I think people would enjoy it.") The tumult has certainly been immense for the famously enthusiastic B2K fans. This makes the film's rather weak representation of at least one source of tension -- Omarion getting all the attention -- something like the proverbial car wreck, simultaneously hard to see and hard to turn away from. At least the dance scenes supply their own, more potent, mini-dramas, so the rest of it becomes less salient.

reviews.review_title: A Film That will make you get out of your theatre seat and jump and dance
reviews.content: I really don't think this is a bad film, okay it really just focuses on one type of audience ........any one that is a teenager and is interested in hip hop dance. Maybe the camera angles could have been better or the editing refined. The story is a lil weak but when you sit there for an hour and a bit you feel happy that you have spent a fiver to watch a good film. The dancing is fantastic and perfectly choreographed and makes you wanna tap your feet. Overall the film is a great one for the first time actors and is a great film with money well spent to any one that disagrees 3 words for you.................YOU GOT SERVED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: David and Elgen(Omarion and Marques)are trying to fulfill their dreams by dancing for money but a problem comes up when another group beats them in a dance contest
reviews.content: What's up I just wanna say that I have seen the movie you got serve and unlike the others I thought it was great.I mean come on how could it not be Omarion is in it.Anyways like I was saying I thought the movie had great dancing and it was interesting,yeah some parts were sad like when the little boy died and when Marques gets beat up (I even cried).The only part I didn't like was when Omarion kisses Jennifer I know it was just acting, but a girl went crazy up in the movies when that happened plus after that there were rumors saying that there was something going on between them.So like I said I thought it was great and I'm a big fan of Omarion so it's kinda hard for me not 2 like it.Holla at you laterpeace

Although the story might not have played out as well as it might have, the dance moves alone make this film an interesting watch. The actors might not be the most experienced actors but the story is not hard to follow and the break dancing is wild. My family enjoy watching dance movies and would rate the level of difficulty, right up there. I am a film maker myself and feel that the people that made this film did okay. The cinematography during the dancing sequences is sound and the energy of the film is good. I have seen a number of films from the larger studios with far bigger budgets then this film that have made a complete hash of things. These film makers will be better for the experience and I look forward to their next effort.The story could have done with some work but overall a reasonable effort.

reviews.review_title: Awesome! Great dancing and soundtrack.. will make you bounce in your seat!
reviews.content: In seeing a poor review of this movie that i felt did not give it justice at all, i was compelled to write my own. It's no classic but if you're into Hip Hop music and appreciate dancing of any sort you'll find this movie entertaining to say the least! The plot is basic but the great soundtrack and amazing dancing make up for that big time! There are no Oscar winning performances but keep in mind the stars of this movie are primarily singers/dancers and the dancing is meant to be the star of this show. It's a teen movie but still creative and unique in it's own right. If you liked the movie "Honey" starring Jessica Alba this movie is a must see! It's got the same vibe.. the same attitude.. and it's all about the dancing. It may even inspire you to take up dancing lessons.. or at least buy the soundtrack and dance in your bedroom to your own style.
